column2: A ultra-orthodox Sunni Muslim sect advocating a return to the early Islam of the Koran and Sunna.

Athari is a school of traditionalist Islamic scholars who reject Islamic "theology" (kalam) in favor of strict textualism in interpreting the Quran. The name is derived from the Arabic word athar, literally meaning "remnant", and also referring to "narrations". Their disciples are called the Atharis.
Maturidi is a school of Islam with a emphasis on human reasoning and rationality
Embrace the Athari school of Sunni Islam
Embrace the Maturidi school of Sunni Islam
